title: Hereâ€™s How to Protect Your Crypto and Seed Phrases From Natural Disasters
text:
Synopsis
The crypto industry needs to move beyond traditional seed phrase storage methods and adopt more secure, resilient self-custody technologies like Multi-Party Computation (MPC) and Account Abstraction (AA) wallets to protect users' assets from potential loss during natural disasters.

Key Insights
- Approximately $250 trillion worth of Bitcoin has been lost or stolen in the last 10 years due to seed phrase mismanagement
- Current seed phrase storage methods are vulnerable to complete loss during natural disasters like fires
- Emerging technologies like MPC wallets break private keys into multiple locations, eliminating single points of failure
- Account Abstraction (AA) wallets offer alternative secure self-custody solutions
- The crypto ecosystem needs to prioritize developing more user-friendly and disaster-resistant asset protection methods
- Current self-custody approaches are too complex for average users to implement effectively
- Existing solutions like separating seed phrases across different geographies are impractical for most people
- The industry should focus on building more accessible and secure asset management technologies
